▿ Step
  ResponseEnded

▿ Request
  GET http://localhost:8080/episodes
  Authorization: Basic aGVsbG86d29ybGQ=

  (Data, 0 bytes)

▿ Response
  Status 200 OK
  Content-Length: 63671
  Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8

href="/episodes" class="px1">Videos</a></li><li class="inline"><a href="#" class="px1">Blog</a></li><li class="inline"><a href="#" class="px1">Books</a></li><li class="inline"><a href="/about" class="px1">About</a></li></ul></div><div class=" col"><ul class="right list-reset m0"><li class="inline"><a href="/login?redirect=http://localhost:8080/episodes" class="px1">Login</a></li><li class="inline"><a href="/pricing" class="px1">Subscribe</a></li></ul></div></div><div class=" row"><div class=" col col-xs-12 col-md-9"><div class="px4 pb2 pt3"><ul class="list-reset"><li><div class="mb4 row"><div class=" col col-xs-4"><div class="pr3"><a href="/episodes/ep4-type-safe-html-in-swift"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64, " alt="" class="bg-black-50 fit" style="width:100%;max-height:200px;object-fit:cover"></a></div></div><div class=" col col-xs-8"><div><strong class="h6 caps lh-1">Episode 4</strong><h5 class="pf-title-3"><a href="/episodes/ep4-type-safe-html-in-swift">Type-Safe HTML in Swift</a></h5><p class="pf-callout">As server-side Swift becomes more popular and widely adopted, it will be important to re-examine some of the past “best-practices” of web frameworks to see how Swift’s type system can improve upon them.</p><div><ol class="inline-block list-reset"><li class="inline-block mr1 mb1"><a href="/episodes?tag=DSL" class="h6 px2 py1 pill border bg-white text-decoration-none">DSL</a></li><li class="inline-block mr1 mb1"><a href="/episodes?tag=HTML" class="h6 px2 py1 pill border bg-white text-decoration-none">HTML</a></li><li class="inline-block mr1 mb1"><a href="/episodes?tag=Server-Side%20Swift" class="h6 px2 py1 pill border bg-white text-decoration-none">Server-Side Swift</a></li></ol></div></div></div></div></li><li><div class="mb4 row"><div class=" col col-xs-4"><div class="pr3"><a href="/episodes/ep3-the-algebra-of-predicates-and-sorting-functions"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64, " alt="" class="bg-black-50 fit" style="width:100%;max-height:200px;object-fit:cover"></a></div></div><div class=" col col-xs-8"><div><strong class="h6 caps lh-1">Episode 3</strong><h5 class="pf-title-3"><a href="/episodes/ep3-the-algebra-of-predicates-and-sorting-functions">The Algebra of Predicates and Sorting Functions</a></h5><p class="pf-callout">We formulate predicates and sorting functions in terms of monoids and show how they can lead to very composable constructions.</p><div><ol class="inline-block list-reset"><li class="inline-block mr1 mb1"><a href="/episodes?tag=Algebra" class="h6 px2 py1 pill border bg-white text-decoration-none">Algebra</a></li><li class="inline-block mr1 mb1"><a href="/episodes?tag=Math" class="h6 px2 py1 pill border bg-white text-decoration-none">Math</a></li></ol></div></div></div></div></li><li><div class="mb4 row"><div class=" col col-xs-4"><div class="pr3"><a href="/episodes/ep2-algebraic-structure-and-protocols"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64, " alt="" class="bg-black-50 fit" style="width:100%;max-height:200px;object-fit:cover"></a></div></div><div class=" col col-xs-8"><div><strong class="h6 caps lh-1">Episode 2</strong><h5 class="pf-title-3"><a href="/episodes/ep2-algebraic-structure-and-protocols">Algebraic Structure and Protocols</a></h5><p class="pf-callout">Protocols in Swift allow us to abstractly work with types that we know very little about. We distill the smallest piece of an interface that we want a type to conform to, and then we can write functions that are highly reusable. Mathematicians do something very similar to study objects abstractly, and it forms the field known as algebra. In this article we will link these two worlds together, and show that there is a fundamental piece missing when we only look at the protocol level.</p><div><ol class="inline-block list-reset"><li class="inline-block mr1 mb1"><a href="/episodes?tag=Algebra" class="h6 px2 py1 pill border bg-white text-decoration-none">Algebra</a></li><li class="inline-block mr1 mb1"><a href="/episodes?tag=Math" class="h6 px2 py1 pill border bg-white text-decoration-none">Math</a></li></ol></div></div></div></div></li><li><div class="mb4 row"><div class=" col col-xs-4"><div class="pr3"><a href="/episodes/ep1-proof-in-functions"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64, " alt="" class="bg-black-50 fit" style="width:100%;max-height:200px;object-fit:cover"></a></div></div><div class=" col col-xs-8"><div><strong class="h6 caps lh-1">Episode 1</strong><h5 class="pf-title-3"><a href="/episodes/ep1-proof-in-functions">Proof in Functions</a></h5><p class="pf-callout">Swift’s generic functions allow us to explore a beautiful idea that straddles the line between mathematics and computer science</p><div><ol class="inline-block list-reset"><li class="inline-block mr1 mb1"><a href="/episodes?tag=Algebra" class="h6 px2 py1 pill border bg-white text-decoration-none">Algebra</a></li><li class="inline-block mr1 mb1"><a href="/episodes?tag=Generics" class="h6 px2 py1 pill border bg-white text-decoration-none">Generics</a></li><li class="inline-block mr1 mb1"><a href="/episodes?tag=Polymorphism" class="h6 px2 py1 pill border bg-white text-decoration-none">Polymorphism</a></li><li class="inline-block mr1 mb1"><a href="/episodes?tag=Programming" class="h6 px2 py1 pill border bg-white text-decoration-none">Programming</a></li><li class="inline-block mr1 mb1"><a href="/episodes?tag=Swift" class="h6 px2 py1 pill border bg-white text-decoration-none">Swift</a></li></ol></div></div></div></div></li></ul></div></div><div class="xs-hide sm-hide col col-md-3"><div class="pr4 pb2 pt3 sticky-md top-0"><h5 class="pf-subhead">Sort by</h5><ol class="list-reset pb2"><li><a href="#">Newest first</a></li><li><a href="#">Oldest
